column4: hey everyone question, how do I dd all the data off a hard drive to an iso image?
you really dont do it that way.
you can use other commands/tools/ but not dd normally for that task
I have to copy every bit of data from the drive to a file
and how big  is this drive?
so you are going to backup a HD via dd to some 15 DVD disks?
use a backup tool like fsarchiver, or other tools.
no I need it to copy the data sector-by-sector as-is to an ISO FILE
no I need it to copy the data sector-by-sector as-is to an ISO FILE
the why really has no bearing on how to do it
good luck then..  fromw hat i know your idea. wont work.
I was told the command to dd the data off the drive to an ISO FILE drivedata.iso
that will not make an iso filesystem. that will make a data dump of whatever filesystem is on the partition. it wont handle splitting it into 4gb parts either.. and how will you restore it?
dd wont make it an iso file. it will make a 'raw' image file of that part of the hard drive. thats not an iso file.
is it even supported by cups? check cups.org?
